oracle.iam.identity.icf.connector.openfire.provider

Class FlagProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.iam.identity.icf.foundation.logging.AbstractLoggable
      • oracle.iam.identity.icf.connector.openfire.Provider<User.Flag>
        • oracle.iam.identity.icf.connector.openfire.provider.FlagProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    oracle.iam.identity.icf.foundation.logging.Loggable

    public final class FlagProvider
extends Provider<User.Flag>
    Default implementation of the FlagProvider interface for Users, which reads and writes data from the ofUserFlag database table.
    This implementation will not explicitly verify if a user exists, when operating on its properties.
    The methods of this implementation will not throw an exception if the user does not exists.
    Warning:
    In virtually all cases a user property provider should not be used directly. Instead, use the User.Flag returned by User#flag() to create, read, update or delete user properties.
    Failure to do so is likely to result in inconsistent data behavior and race conditions. Direct access to the user property provider is only provided for special-case logic.
    Since:
    1.0.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0.0
